name: spw
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0, wff w1

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wn(w1), wal(s0, wn(w1)))
-| wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wn(w0), wal(s1, wn(w0)))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wn(w1), wal(s0, wn(w1)))
-| wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wn(w0), wal(s1, wn(w0)))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)

|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| wi(wn(w0), wal(s1, wn(w0)))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffsw(s0, wn(w1))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, wal(s0, w0)))
-| diffsw(s1, wal(s0, w0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wn(w0), wal(s1, wn(w0)))
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffsw(s0, wn(w1))
-| diffsw(s1, wal(s0, w0))

|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffsw(s0, wn(w1))
-| diffsw(s1, wal(s0, w0))
-| diffsw(s1, wn(w0))

|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffsw(s1, wal(s0, w0))
-| diffsw(s1, wn(w0))
-| diffsw(s0, w1)

body.origin:
|- diffsw(s1, wal(s0, w0))
-| diffss(s1, s0)
-| diffsw(s1, w0)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffsw(s1, wn(w0))
-| diffsw(s0, w1)
-| diffss(s1, s0)
-| diffsw(s1, w0)

|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffsw(s1, wn(w0))
-| diffsw(s0, w1)
-| diffsw(s1, w0)

|- wi(wal(s0, w0), w0)
-| wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), wb(w0, w1))
-| diffss(s0, s1)
-| diffsw(s0, w1)
-| diffsw(s1, w0)

comment: Weak version of the specialization scheme ~ sp . Lemma 9 of [KalishMontague] p. 87. While it appears that ~ sp in its general form does not follow from Tarski's FOL axiom schemes, from this theorem we can prove any _instance_ of ~ sp having mutually distinct setvar variables and no wff metavariables (see ~ ax12wdemo for an example of the procedure to eliminate the hypothesis). Other approximations of ~ sp are ~ spfw (minimal distinct variable requirements), ~ spnfw (when ` x ` is not free in ` -. ph ` ), ~ spvw (when ` x ` does not appear in ` ph ` ), ~ sptruw (when ` ph ` is true), and ~ spfalw (when ` ph ` is false). (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-2017.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 27-Feb-2018.)
